verses.text: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother was his counselor in sinning.
parts: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother was his counselor in sinning.

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord, similarly to the house of Ahab, for after the death of his father they were his counselors to his destruction.
parts: He did evil in the sight of the Lord, similarly to the house of Ahab, for after the death of his father they were his counselors to his destruction.

verses.text: He followed their advice and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth Gilead, whose archers wounded Joram. †
parts: He followed their advice and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth Gilead, whose archers wounded Joram.

verses.text: Joram returned to Jezreel to recover from his wounds the Syrians inflicted in Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria.
parts: Joram returned to Jezreel to recover from his wounds the Syrians inflicted in Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria.

verses.text: His going to Jehoram was God's opportunity for Ahaziah's downfall.
parts: His going to Jehoram was God's opportunity for Ahaziah's downfall.

verses.text: And when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, he found both the princes of Judah, and the sons of Ahaziah's brothers who served Ahaziah, and killed them.
parts: And when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, he found both the princes of Judah, and the sons of Ahaziah's brothers who served Ahaziah, and killed them.

verses.text: Jehu gave orders to search for Ahaziah in Samaria where he was recuperating, and they brought him to Jehu.
parts: Jehu gave orders to search for Ahaziah in Samaria where he was recuperating, and they brought him to Jehu.

verses.text: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal heirs of the house of Judah. But Jehoshabeath the king's daughter took Joash, the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king's sons being murdered, and she put him and his nurse in a bedroom.

verses.text: He remained hidden with them in the house of God for six years while Athaliah reigned over the land.
parts: He remained hidden with them in the house of God for six years while Athaliah reigned over the land.

verses.text: In the seventh year, Jehoiada strengthened himself and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri with him into the house. They went throughout Judah and gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah, and the leaders of the families of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.
parts: In the seventh year, Jehoiada strengthened himself and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri with him into the house.
They went throughout Judah and gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah, and the leaders of the families of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.

verses.text: Then all the assembly of Judah made a covenant with the king in the house of God.
parts: Then all the assembly of Judah made a covenant with the king in the house of God.

verses.text: This is what you shall do: One-third of the priests and the Levites who enter on the Sabbath shall keep watch over the entrance gates.
parts: This is what you shall do: One-third of the priests and the Levites who enter on the Sabbath shall keep watch over the entrance gates.

verses.text: One-third shall be at the king's house.
parts: One-third shall be at the king's house.

verses.text: But let no one come into the house of the Lord except the priests and those Levites who serve.
parts: But let no one come into the house of the Lord except the priests and those Levites who serve.

verses.text: And the Levites shall surround the king on all sides, every man with his weapons in his hand, and whoever comes into the house will be put to death.
parts: And the Levites shall surround the king on all sides, every man with his weapons in his hand, and whoever comes into the house will be put to death.

verses.text: So the Levites and all Judah did everything Jehoiada the priest commanded.
parts: So the Levites and all Judah did everything Jehoiada the priest commanded.

verses.text: And he gave them the swords and shields and weapons which had belonged to King David that were in the house of God.
parts: And he gave them the swords and shields and weapons which had belonged to King David that were in the house of God.

verses.text: Then he stationed all the people, every man with his weapon in his hands, from the right side of the temple to the left side of the temple, and next to the altar and by the temple, and all around the king.
parts: Then he stationed all the people, every man with his weapon in his hands, from the right side of the temple to the left side of the temple, and next to the altar and by the temple, and all around the king.

verses.text: And they brought out the king's son, put the crown on him, gave him the Testimony, and made him king.
parts: And they brought out the king's son, put the crown on him, gave him the Testimony, and made him king.

verses.text: Now when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and giving thanks and praising the king, she came to the king in the house of the Lord. When she looked, there was the king standing by his pillar at the entrance, with the leaders and the trumpeters around the king.
parts: Now when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and giving thanks and praising the king, she came to the king in the house of the Lord.
When she looked, there was the king standing by his pillar at the entrance, with the leaders and the trumpeters around the king.

parts: When she looked, there was the king standing by his pillar at the entrance, with the leaders and the trumpeters around the king.

verses.text: Jehoiada the priest went out and commanded the captains of hundreds, who were set over the army, and said to them, “Take her out of the house and slay whoever follows her with the sword.” For the priest said, “Do not kill her in the house of the Lord.”
parts: Jehoiada the priest went out and commanded the captains of hundreds, who were set over the army, and said to them, “Take her out of the house and slay whoever follows her with the sword.” For the priest said, “Do not kill her in the house of the Lord.”

verses.text: So they seized her, and she went into the king's house by the entrance of the Horse Gate, and there they killed her.
parts: So they seized her, and she went into the king's house by the entrance of the Horse Gate, and there they killed her.

verses.text: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, the people, and the king, that they should be the Lord's people.
parts: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, the people, and the king, that they should be the Lord's people.

verses.text: And all the people went to the house of Baal and tore it down.
parts: And all the people went to the house of Baal and tore it down.

verses.text: Also, Jehoiada the priest strengthened the works of the house of the Lord in the hand of the priests and the Levites whom David had assigned in the house of the Lord, to offer the burnt offerings of the Lord as it is written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and singing as it was established by David.
parts: Also, Jehoiada the priest strengthened the works of the house of the Lord in the hand of the priests and the Levites whom David had assigned in the house of the Lord, to offer the burnt offerings of the Lord as it is written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and singing as it was established by David.

verses.text: And the gatekeepers stood at the gates of the house of the Lord so no one unclean should possibly enter.
parts: And the gatekeepers stood at the gates of the house of the Lord so no one unclean should possibly enter.

verses.text: Then he took the leaders of the families, the mighty men, the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought the king into the house of the Lord.
parts: Then he took the leaders of the families, the mighty men, the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought the king into the house of the Lord.

verses.text: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet, for they had slain Athaliah with the sword.
parts: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet, for they had slain Athaliah with the sword.

verses.text: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned for forty years in Jerusalem.
parts: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned for forty years in Jerusalem.

verses.text: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord for all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
parts: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord for all the days of Jehoiada the priest.

verses.text: And Jehoiada took two wives and begot sons and daughters.
parts: And Jehoiada took two wives and begot sons and daughters.

verses.text: After this, Joash set his heart on repairing the house of the Lord.
parts: After this, Joash set his heart on repairing the house of the Lord.

verses.text: So he gathered the priests and the Levites and said to them, “Go out to the cities of Judah and gather money from all Israel to repair the house of your God from year to year.
parts: So he gathered the priests and the Levites and said to them, “Go out to the cities of Judah and gather money from all Israel to repair the house of your God from year to year.

verses.text: So the king called Jehoiada the chief priest and said to him, “Why did you not require the Levites to bring in the collection from Judah and Jerusalem, according to the commandment of Moses the man of God when he assembled Israel at the tabernacle of witness?”
parts: So the king called Jehoiada the chief priest and said to him, “Why did you not require the Levites to bring in the collection from Judah and Jerusalem, according to the commandment of Moses the man of God when he assembled Israel at the tabernacle of witness?”

verses.text: For Athaliah, a wicked woman, and her sons broke into the house of God and gave all the dedicated things of the house of the Lord to the Baals.
parts: For Athaliah, a wicked woman, and her sons broke into the house of God and gave all the dedicated things of the house of the Lord to the Baals.

verses.text: Then at the king's command, they made a chest and set it outside at the gate of the house of the Lord.
parts: Then at the king's command, they made a chest and set it outside at the gate of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: And they made a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem, to bring to the Lord the collection that Moses the servant of God imposed on Israel in the desert.
parts: And they made a proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem, to bring to the Lord the collection that Moses the servant of God imposed on Israel in the desert.

verses.text: And all the leaders and all the people gave and brought their contributions.
parts: And all the leaders and all the people gave and brought their contributions.

verses.text: So at that time, when the chest was brought to the king's official by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw there was a lot of money, the king's scribe and the high priest's officer came and emptied the chest and returned it to its place.
parts: So at that time, when the chest was brought to the king's official by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw there was a lot of money, the king's scribe and the high priest's officer came and emptied the chest and returned it to its place.

verses.text: The king and Jehoiada gave it to those who did the work of the service of the house of the Lord.
parts: The king and Jehoiada gave it to those who did the work of the service of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: So the workmen labored, and by their hand the amount of work being completed increased.
parts: So the workmen labored, and by their hand the amount of work being completed increased.

verses.text: When they finished, they brought the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada.
parts: When they finished, they brought the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada.

verses.text: But Jehoiada grew old and full of days, and he died.
parts: But Jehoiada grew old and full of days, and he died.

verses.text: They buried him in the City of David with the kings, because he had done good in Israel toward God and His house.
parts: They buried him in the City of David with the kings, because he had done good in Israel toward God and His house.

verses.text: Now after the death of Jehoiada, the leaders of Judah came and bowed down to the king.
parts: Now after the death of Jehoiada, the leaders of Judah came and bowed down to the king.

verses.text: And they left the Lord God of their fathers to serve Asherah and the idols.
parts: And they left the Lord God of their fathers to serve Asherah and the idols.

verses.text: But still He sent prophets to them to bring them back to the Lord, but they did not listen.
parts: But still He sent prophets to them to bring them back to the Lord, but they did not listen.

verses.text: Then the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest, who watched over the people, and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Why do you transgress the commandments of the Lord, so that you cannot prosper?
parts: Then the Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest, who watched over the people, and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: ‘Why do you transgress the commandments of the Lord, so that you cannot prosper?

verses.text: So they conspired against Zechariah, and at the command of the king they stoned him with stones in the court of the house of the Lord.
parts: So they conspired against Zechariah, and at the command of the king they stoned him with stones in the court of the house of the Lord.

verses.text: Thus Joash the king did not remember the mercy Jehoiada his father had shown him, but killed his son.
parts: Thus Joash the king did not remember the mercy Jehoiada his father had shown him, but killed his son.

verses.text: So after the end of the year, the army of Syria came up against him.
parts: So after the end of the year, the army of Syria came up against him.

verses.text: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men, but the Lord delivered a very great army into their hand, because they had forsaken the Lord God of their fathers.
parts: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men, but the Lord delivered a very great army into their hand, because they had forsaken the Lord God of their fathers.

verses.text: When Syria withdrew, they had left him severely wounded.
parts: When Syria withdrew, they had left him severely wounded.

verses.text: Those who conspired against him were Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonite, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabite.
parts: Those who conspired against him were Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonite, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabite.

verses.text: He had five sons.
parts: He had five sons.

verses.text: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem.
parts: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned for twenty-nine years in Jerusalem.

verses.text: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, but not with a loyal heart.
parts: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, but not with a loyal heart.

verses.text: As soon as the kingdom was established for him, he executed his servants who murdered his father the king.
parts: As soon as the kingdom was established for him, he executed his servants who murdered his father the king.

verses.text: However, he did not execute their children, for as it is written in the Law in the Book of Moses where the Lord commands, saying, “The fathers shall not be put to death for their sons, nor shall the sons be put to death for their fathers, but each person shall die for his own sin.”
parts: However, he did not execute their children, for as it is written in the Law in the Book of Moses where the Lord commands, saying, “The fathers shall not be put to death for their sons, nor shall the sons be put to death for their fathers, but each person shall die for his own sin.”

verses.text: Amaziah gathered the house of Judah then according to their fathers’ houses throughout Judah and Jerusalem, and set over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds.
parts: Amaziah gathered the house of Judah then according to their fathers’ houses throughout Judah and Jerusalem, and set over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds.

verses.text: And from Israel for one hundred talents of silver he hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valor.
parts: And from Israel for one hundred talents of silver he hired one hundred thousand mighty men of valor.

verses.text: But a man of God came to him, saying, “King, the army of Israel will not go with you, for the Lord is not with Israel, nor with any of the sons of Ephraim;
parts: But a man of God came to him, saying, “King, the army of Israel will not go with you, for the Lord is not with Israel, nor with any of the sons of Ephraim;

verses.text: and if you try to be strong in battle, the Lord will cast you down before the enemy, for the Lord has power to strengthen and to overthrow.”
parts: and if you try to be strong in battle, the Lord will cast you down before the enemy, for the Lord has power to strengthen and to overthrow.”

verses.text: Then Amaziah said to the man of God, “But what shall we do about the hundred talents I gave the army of Israel?” And the man of God answered, “The Lord can give you more than this.”
parts: Then Amaziah said to the man of God, “But what shall we do about the hundred talents I gave the army of Israel?” And the man of God answered, “The Lord can give you more than this.”

verses.text: So Amaziah discharged the troops that had come to him from Ephraim and sent them back home.
parts: So Amaziah discharged the troops that had come to him from Ephraim and sent them back home.

verses.text: And Amaziah strengthened himself and led his people and went to the Valley of Salt, where he killed ten thousand of the sons of Seir. The sons of Judah took ten thousand men captive, brought them to the top of the rock, and cast them down from there.
parts: And Amaziah strengthened himself and led his people and went to the Valley of Salt, where he killed ten thousand of the sons of Seir.
The sons of Judah took ten thousand men captive, brought them to the top of the rock, and cast them down from there.

verses.text: The sons of Judah took ten thousand men captive, brought them to the top of the rock, and cast them down from there.
parts: The sons of Judah took ten thousand men captive, brought them to the top of the rock, and cast them down from there.

verses.text: As for the sons of the army Amaziah discharged so they would not go to war with him, they raided the cities of Judah from Samaria to Beth Horon and killed three thousand in them, and took a great deal of spoil.
parts: As for the sons of the army Amaziah discharged so they would not go to war with him, they raided the cities of Judah from Samaria to Beth Horon and killed three thousand in them, and took a great deal of spoil.

verses.text: After Amaziah came from the slaughter of the Edomites, he brought the gods of the sons of Seir, set them up to be his gods, and bowed down before them and burned incense to them.
parts: After Amaziah came from the slaughter of the Edomites, he brought the gods of the sons of Seir, set them up to be his gods, and bowed down before them and burned incense to them.

verses.text: Therefore the anger of the Lord was aroused against Amaziah, and He sent prophets who said to him, “Why did you seek the gods of the people who could not rescue their own people from your hand?”
parts: Therefore the anger of the Lord was aroused against Amaziah, and He sent prophets who said to him, “Why did you seek the gods of the people who could not rescue their own people from your hand?”

verses.text: As he talked with him, the king said to him, “Have we made you the king's counselor?
parts: As he talked with him, the king said to him, “Have we made you the king's counselor?

verses.text: Now Amaziah king of Judah sought advice and sent to Joash the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu the king of Israel, saying, “Come, let us face one another in battle.” And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, “The thistle in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son as wife,’ and the beasts of the field will come in Lebanon, and the beasts came and trampled the thistle.
parts: Now Amaziah king of Judah sought advice and sent to Joash the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu the king of Israel, saying, “Come, let us face one another in battle.” And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, “The thistle in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son as wife,’ and the beasts of the field will come in Lebanon, and the beasts came and trampled the thistle.

parts: And Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, “The thistle in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son as wife,’ and the beasts of the field will come in Lebanon, and the beasts came and trampled the thistle.

verses.text: Indeed, you say you defeated the Edomites, and your heart is lifted up to boast.
parts: Indeed, you say you defeated the Edomites, and your heart is lifted up to boast.

verses.text: But Amaziah did not listen, as it came from God for him to be given into the hands of his enemies, since he sought the gods of Edom.
parts: But Amaziah did not listen, as it came from God for him to be given into the hands of his enemies, since he sought the gods of Edom.

verses.text: So Joash king of Israel went out, and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced one another at Beth Shemesh, which belongs to Judah.
parts: So Joash king of Israel went out, and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced one another at Beth Shemesh, which belongs to Judah.

verses.text: And Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man fled to his tent.
parts: And Judah was defeated by Israel, and every man fled to his tent.

verses.text: Then Joash the king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, at Beth Shemesh.
parts: Then Joash the king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash, at Beth Shemesh.

verses.text: And he took all the gold and silver, all the articles that were found in the house of the Lord with Obed-Edom, the treasures of the king's house, and the sons of mixed marriages, and returned to Samaria.
parts: And he took all the gold and silver, all the articles that were found in the house of the Lord with Obed-Edom, the treasures of the king's house, and the sons of mixed marriages, and returned to Samaria.

verses.text: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Joash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.
parts: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived for fifteen years after the death of Joash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, from first to last, are they not written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel?
parts: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, from first to last, are they not written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel?

verses.text: When Amaziah turned from the Lord, they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish.
parts: When Amaziah turned from the Lord, they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish.

verses.text: Then they brought him on horses and buried him with his fathers in the City of David.
parts: Then they brought him on horses and buried him with his fathers in the City of David.

verses.text: Now all the people of the land took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king instead of his father Amaziah. He built Elath and restored it to Judah after the king rested with his fathers.
parts: Now all the people of the land took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.
He built Elath and restored it to Judah after the king rested with his fathers.

verses.text: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem.
parts: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned for fifty-two years in Jerusalem.

verses.text: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, according to everything his father Amaziah had done.
parts: And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord, according to everything his father Amaziah had done.

verses.text: He sought the Lord in the days of Zechariah, who was wise in the fear of the Lord.
parts: He sought the Lord in the days of Zechariah, who was wise in the fear of the Lord.

verses.text: Now he went out and made war against the Philistines and broke down the walls of Gath, the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod.
parts: Now he went out and made war against the Philistines and broke down the walls of Gath, the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod.

verses.text: God strengthened him against the foreigners, against the Arabs who lived in the rock, and against the Meunites.
parts: God strengthened him against the foreigners, against the Arabs who lived in the rock, and against the Meunites.

verses.text: And the Meunites brought tribute to Uzziah.
parts: And the Meunites brought tribute to Uzziah.

verses.text: And Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, at the Valley Gate, and at the corner buttress of the wall, and he fortified them.
parts: And Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate, at the Valley Gate, and at the corner buttress of the wall, and he fortified them.

verses.text: He also built towers in the desert.
parts: He also built towers in the desert.

verses.text: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men who went out to war by companies, according to the number on their roll as prepared by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.
parts: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men who went out to war by companies, according to the number on their roll as prepared by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.

verses.text: The total number of chief officers of the mighty men of valor was two thousand six hundred.
parts: The total number of chief officers of the mighty men of valor was two thousand six hundred.

verses.text: And the power of an expert military force, equal to three hundred seven thousand five hundred, was with them to help the king against the enemy.
parts: And the power of an expert military force, equal to three hundred seven thousand five hundred, was with them to help the king against the enemy.

verses.text: And for each of them in the army, Uzziah prepared shields, spears, helmets, body armor, bows, and slings for stones.
parts: And for each of them in the army, Uzziah prepared shields, spears, helmets, body armor, bows, and slings for stones.

verses.text: And in Jerusalem, he built devices invented by skilled men for the launching of javelins and large stones, and placed them on the towers and corners of the devices.
parts: And in Jerusalem, he built devices invented by skilled men for the launching of javelins and large stones, and placed them on the towers and corners of the devices.

verses.text: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction; for he transgressed against the Lord his God by entering the temple of the Lord to burn incense on the incense altar.
parts: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up to his destruction; for he transgressed against the Lord his God by entering the temple of the Lord to burn incense on the incense altar.

verses.text: So Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him were eighty valiant priests of the Lord.
parts: So Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him were eighty valiant priests of the Lord.

verses.text: And they challenged King Uzziah and said to him, “It is not for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the Lord, but for the priests, the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense.
parts: And they challenged King Uzziah and said to him, “It is not for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the Lord, but for the priests, the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense.

verses.text: Then Uzziah became furious with the priests while holding a censer in his hand to burn incense.
parts: Then Uzziah became furious with the priests while holding a censer in his hand to burn incense.

verses.text: And Azariah the chief priest and all the priests looked on, for he was leprous on his forehead.
parts: And Azariah the chief priest and all the priests looked on, for he was leprous on his forehead.

verses.text: King Uzziah was a leper until the day of his death, and because he was a leper he dwelt in an isolated house and was excluded from the house of the Lord.
parts: King Uzziah was a leper until the day of his death, and because he was a leper he dwelt in an isolated house and was excluded from the house of the Lord.

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, from first to last, are written by the prophet Isaiah.

author: Ezra is believed to be the writer.
date: About 450 BC. The book spans the forty years of Solomon's reign, four hundred years of the reigns of succeeding kings, and seventy years of captivity in Babylon.
theme: Major Themes—Continuation of the Davidic covenant through Solomon and the building of the temple. The importance of proper worship in the temple, particularly the place of the Levites and the musicians, is given special, detailed emphasis. Another theme is the character of each of the kings that followed Solomon—whether they encouraged proper worship of God. The writer ends this book with the tragic account of the destruction of Jerusalem and the seventy-year exile of the Jews to Babylon.
